Experiment Method.Assay Method: Live-cell imaging and mitochondrial function analysis

Material used.Description: Primary cortical neurons overexpressing mutant A53T alpha-synuclein were used to assess mitochondrial destruction and bioenergetic deficits.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Increased mitochondrial destruction and bioenergetic deficits
Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of A53T alpha-synuclein led to significant mitochondrial fragmentation, reduced ATP production, and neuronal degeneration compared to control neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Control neurons without A53T mutation were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Neurons with wild-type alpha-synuclein were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial integrity > 80% and ATP production > 70% of control

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial integrity < 40% and ATP production < 30% of control

Material used.Material Name: siRNA targeting Parkin, Mitofusin 2, or Dynamin-related protein 1
Material used.Description: siRNA or overexpression vectors were used to manipulate Parkin, Mitofusin 2, or Dynamin-related protein 1 in neurons with A53T alpha-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: Inhibition of Parkin or Dynamin-related protein 1 reduced mitochondrial degradation, while overexpression of Mitofusin 2 mitigated A53T-induced mitochondrial dysfunction.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Control siRNA or empty vectors were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without siRNA treatment were used as negative controls.
